business.headline: Trading halted on Pakistan stock exchange after 7% crash post Operation SindoorAccording to the official notification from the exchange, trading was paused after the benchmark index plunged 6.3% in a short period. The sharp fall triggered automatic circuit breakers to stop further decline.

ITR Filing 2025: What is ITR Form 3, check eliigibility, documents and deadlinesYou should file ITR-3 if you run a business or work as a self-employed professional, regardless of whether a tax audit is needed.

India-Pak tensions lift Chinese jet maker's stock by 36% in 2 daysAs of Thursday, the company's share price rose by 16.37% to reach 80.68 yuan. This was after a 17% jump on Wednesday. In total, the stock has gained 36.21% in two days and has gone up 44% in the past one month.

'Retirement age is moving from 60 to 45': An investment banker explains whyUnlike lawyers or doctors, where experience adds value, senior professionals in corporate roles like sales, marketing, operations, product, and tech, are seen as costly and sometimes out of touch, said the investment banker.

Why stock market investors shouldn't panic amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsWhile 'Operation Sindoor' led to worries about increased market volatility and losses, the main indices on Dalal Street actually managed to end in green in the previous session. Even today, the stock markets are trading in positive territory.

Pakistan's forex is slipping fast. More trouble ahead for already debt-ridden economy?A bailout by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), including a loan of $2 billion in March this year, gave Pakistan some breathing room. But the current situation could undo much of that progress.

'You can now automate strategies': Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on NSE's new algo rulesZerodha's founder and CEO, Nithin Kamath, hailed NSE's new rules to ease algo trading for retail users and explained the main update in simple terms.

Will rising Indo-Pak tensions dent foreign investment inflows to India?India's economy, which recently crossed the $4 trillion mark, has minimal direct trade with Pakistan. As a result, cross-border missile strikes carried out by India had limited immediate impact on domestic equities, currencies, or bonds.

Google cuts 200 jobs in latest round of restructuring: ReportGoogle described the changes as "small" adjustments meant to foster "greater collaboration" and improve how quickly teams can serve customers.

Sensex, Nifty erase early gains as market reacts to India-Pakistan tensionThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading down by 56.88 points to 80,689.90, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 32.25 points to 24,382.15 as of 9:30 AM.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock market to go down amid India-Pakistan tension?At 8:40 am, Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,451. This suggests that the Nifty50 index may open marginally higher or close to Wednesday's closing level of 24,414.4 as investors are expected to be cautious.
Stocks to watch on May 8: Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints, PNBStocks to watch on Thursday, May 8, include several well-known companies such as Titan, Dabur, L&T, Asian Paints and PNB.
Government issues Letter of Intent to Musk's satellite internet venture StarlinkPrior to this, the government had issued licences to Eutelsat OneWeb and Jio Satellite Communications.

ULIPs, mutual funds or stocks: What's the best for long-term wealth creation?Mutual funds, ULIPs, and stocks offer different paths to wealth. While ULIPs mix insurance with investment, mutual funds offer flexibility and professional management. Stocks offer high returns but carry more risk and demand expertise.

New NPS rules: How to close your account after renouncing Indian citizenshipAny Indian citizen aged between 18 and 70 years can open an NPS account. Additionally, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Overseas Citizens of India (OCIs) can also open an NPS account, as long as they meet the necessary requirements set by the PFRDA.

Sensex ends 106 points higher, Nifty above 24,400; Tata Motors jumps 5%The BSE Sensex was up 105.71 points higher to 80,746.78 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 34.80 points to settle at 24,414.40. Most of the broader market indices also recovered after falling in early trade.

HDFC Bank trims these lending rates from May 7. Will your EMIs go down?This move comes shortly after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) cut the repo rate by 25 bps in April, taking the total cut to 50 bps since February 2025.

Operation Sindoor: Should Dalal Street investors worry about what's next?There was no sell-off, no bloodbath, just a bit of volatility. For many retail investors, the calm felt unusual — shouldn't a military flare-up between nuclear neighbours spook the markets? But past data suggests otherwise.

Taking a personal loan for a wedding? Here are 6 key tips to keep in mindWeddings can tempt us to go overboard, but it's best to plan a realistic budget. See where you can cut costs or use your savings first. Borrow just the amount you really need, don't take a bigger loan just because you're eligible for it.

Filing ITR? Here's how to choose the right tax regimeWhile the new regime offers reduced tax slabs, it doesn't let you claim the usual deductions available under the old regime. It's lower rates, but with fewer tax-saving options.

Whisky, cars, and jobs: Inside India's game-changing UK free trade pactThe India-UK trade deal holds significance in a world drifting back toward trade barriers and tariff wars. With Trump-era protectionism rearing its head again, the timing of this pact couldn't be better.
PwC to cut 1,500 jobs in the US: ReportLast year, PwC was in the news for possibly cutting half of its auditing staff in China's financial services sector.

Pakistan's Karachi Stock Exchange crashes nearly 6% after 'Operation Sindoor'The Karachi Stock Exchange 100 index (KSE-100) plunged 6,272 points in early trade, sliding to 107,296.64 — a sharp drop from Tuesday's close of 113,568.51.

Explained: Why Info Edge shares look like they've crashed 80% todayInfo Edge shares traded ex-split today after the company carried out a 1:5 stock split, its first since its 2006 listing. As a result, each share with a face value of Rs 10 has been subdivided into five shares of Rs 2 each.

Explained: Why foreign portfolio investors are buying Indian financial stocksData from the National Securities Depository shows FPIs bought Rs 18,409 crore ($2.18 billion) worth of shares in the sector last month, propelling the Nifty Financial Services index to a 4.1% gain.

Scotch whisky prices set to drop after India-UK trade deal. Details hereThe reduction is expected to bring premium and mid-range Scotch whiskies within reach of a larger section of Indian consumers. A bottle that typically costs Rs 5,000 could soon be priced between Rs 3,500 and Rs 4,000 following the initial tariff cut.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market didn't crash after 'Operation Sindoor'While markets remain extremely volatile, swinging between green and red, there was no major crash. Here are three reasons why Dalal Street remained calm after 'Operation Sindoor'.

Sensex, Nifty rebound as markets stay calm after 'Operation Sindoor'The Sensex fell sharply in pre-opening, but recovered as soon as the markets opened at 9:15 am. At around 9:30 am, Sensex was trading 143.08 points higher at 80,784.15, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 56.60 points to trade at 24,432.

Paytm nears full profitability; revenue grows to Rs 1,911 crorePaytm's revenue increased by 5% quarter-on-quarter, reaching Rs 1,911 crore, reflecting the company's steady performance and continued momentum in its core businesses.

Need a personal loan? Unlock Rs 5 lakh instantly using just your PAN cardTo apply online, you simply visit the bank or lender's website and fill out the application form. You'll need to provide your name, date of birth, mobile number, and PAN number.

Sensex ends 156 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Adani Enterprises falls 4%The BSE Sensex ended 155.77 points lower at 80,641.07, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to settle at 24,379.60. Most of the broader market indices also declined during the trading session due to high selling pressure.

Yes Bank denies reports of stake sale to Japan's SMBC, calls it 'speculative'The private sector lender clarified that while it regularly explores business opportunities, there is nothing material to disclose under current regulatory norms.

Saying yes to a joint loan? Here's how it can affect your credit scoreEvery time an EMI is paid on time, it reflects positively on both borrowers' credit profiles. Over time, this builds your credit score. If you were added as a co-applicant to help someone get a loan because your own score was low, this is your chance to improve it.

ITR filing 2025: 5 common mistakes you must avoid while filing your tax returnsUsing the wrong ITR form can delay your tax processing or, worse, your return may get rejected. Also, filing your ITR is not the final step, you must also verify it.

Is the worst over for global economy as Trump eases stance on tariffs?Even as Trump suggests deals are near with countries like India, Japan, and South Korea, and China reviews a fresh proposal from Washington, the global economy isn't breathing easy yet.

Opted for new tax regime? Here's a look at key benefits, what you can claimThe government brought in the new tax regime to make things simpler for taxpayers. It gives you more tax slabs with lower rates, which means you may end up paying less tax.

Ather Energy gives up listing gains, slides 4% after weak debut. Hold or sell?Ather Energy's stock opened at Rs 328 on the NSE, up 2.2% over its issue price of Rs 321, but slipped over 4% to an intraday low of Rs 308.95 amid weak market sentiment.

Sensex down over 200 points. Why is the stock market down today?As of 10:48 am, the BSE Sensex was down 213.43 points at 80,583.41, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 72.40 points to 24,388.75. Broader indices saw sharper cuts, with the Nifty midcap and smallcap indices falling around 1% each, reflecting risk-off sentiment in domestic-focused sectors.

Ather Energy makes muted debut on Dalal Street, lists 2% above IPO priceAt the time of listing, the Bengaluru-based company was valued at around Rs 12,144 crore, slightly below its implied market capitalisation of Rs 12,300 crore at the upper end of the IPO price band (Rs 304–Rs 321).

Explained: Why Yes Bank shares are rising todayYes Bank shares rose sharply as shareholders reacted positively to the news. At around 9:43 am, shares of the bank were trading 5.30% higher at Rs 18.69.

entertainment.headline: Reborn Rich Season 2 production confirmed without Song Joong-kiThe popular 2022 K-drama 'Reborn Rich' has been officially renewed for its eagerly-awaited second season, promising a gripping tale of ambition, love, and power within a global corporation. Fans can look forward to a large-scale production that aims to connect emotionally with international audiences.

Piku and its healing powers: How a film becomes so much more...'Piku', starring Amitabh Bachchan, Deepika Padukone, and the late legendary actor, Irrfan, completes 10 years today. While on the surface, it remains a film about a father-daughter relationship and the art of subtle romance, it is so much more than that. It, in fact, is life itself.

Filmmakers rush to secure Operation Sindoor title, 15 studios seek registrationFollowing India's precision strikes on terror camps, numerous Bollywood studios are rushing to register the title 'Operation Sindoor' for potential war films.

Saif Ali Khan says Taimur has stage fear, doesn't want to perform publiclyTaimur Ali Khan, son of actors Saif Ali Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan, is not interested in acting, said his father. Saif shared that his son feels shy on stage and doesn't like performing in front of people.

When director told Deepika she's 'taking motherhood seriously': Is it compliment?In a recent interview, Deepika Padukone shared an incident where a director commented on her commitment to motherhood. Deepika welcomed her daughter, Dua, in September last year.

Prateik Smita Patil recalls being a drug addict: Was thrown out of film instituteActor Prateik Smita Patil opened up on battling substance abuse. The 'HIT 3' and 'Sikandar' actor revealed that he regrets being in that reckless phase of life. Patil also narrated how he was 'thrown out' of a film institute due to addiction.

Proud of India, have deep respect for government: Mandana Karimi after backlashIranian actor Mandana Karimi faced backlash after her Instagram post mentioning Operation Sindoor. Now, she had reacted to it, clarifying that she is proud of India and has deep respect for the Indian government.

Nostalgia alert! Saif Ali Khan, Rani Mukerji's Hum Tum to re-release on May 16Actors Saif Ali Khan and Rani Mukerji's 'Hum Tum' is set to re-release in theatres on May 16. The film is directed by Kunal Kohli.

Karan Johar recalls his 'kambakht' one-sided love, says it still hurtsKaran Johar talked about experiencing one-sided love, and becoming the 'worst version' of himself, until he used those difficult feelings to 'empower' himself.

Dept. Q trailer: The Queen's Gambit maker promises hooking investigative thrillerThe new Netflix series 'Dept. Q', created by Scott Frank of 'The Queen's Gambit' fame, features Matthew Goode as an eccentric detective dealing with past trauma while solving cold cases in Scotland.

Aimee Lou Wood on SNL skit and her viral crying pics: People are quite boredActor Aimee Lou Wood, best known for 'Sex Education', has spoken up about the viral photos of her crying in public, days after the controversial SNL skit. She clarified that the pictures were unrelated and also urged people to stop over analysing everything.

Shahid Kapoor deletes 'India doesn't provoke' post on Op Sindoor, disables commentsActor Shahid Kapoor deleted his initial post about India's Operation Sindoor and disabled the comments. The actor's unexplained move has left the fans confused.

Actor Raghav Juyal's funny note to SRK for ending his Met Gala confusionActor Raghav Juyal shared a quirky note and thanked SRK for clearing his doubts regarding the Met Gala 2025. This came after SRK's grand debut at the fashion event.

Diljit Dosanjh gives desi-style review to fancy breakfast served after Met GalaDiljit Dosanjh's funny review of a fancy Louis Vuitton breakfast after the Met Gala 2025 has gone viral, winning over fans with his desi humour.

Producer Bhushan Kumar on what's stalling Bollywood: Films don't fail, budgets doBhushan Kumar, head of T-Series, is happy as Ajay Devgn's 'Raid 2' is nearing Rs 100 crore in India. In an interview with India Today, he shared insights on Bollywood's challenges and the path to recovery.

Rajkummar Rao's Bhool Chuk Maaf theatrical release cancelled amid security drillsThe theatrical release of 'Bhool Chuk Maaf', starring Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi, has been cancelled in the light of recent events. The film will now premiere on OTT.

Kylie Jenner, Timothee Chalamet make their relationship red carpet official. PicsKylie Jenner and Timothée Chalamet made their red carpet debut as a couple on Wednesday, May 7, at the David Di Donatello Awards in Rome. Take a look at the pictures here.

Cine association seeks ban on Pakistani artistes over Operation Sindoor remarksThe All India Cine Workers Association (AICWA) has called for a ban on Pakistani artristes. The association criticised statements made by them following India's Operation Sindoor.

Esha Deol says she doesn't behave like a single mother after separationIn a recent interview, Bollywood actress Esha Deol shared insights into her current relationship with her ex-husband Bharat Takhtani. She emphasised her approach to maintaining a cordial connection.

general news.headline: India foils Pak drone-missile attack, 'neutralises' Lahore air defence as counterThe series of explosions in Lahore comes a day after India struck terror camps in Pakistan, in an operation named 'Sindoor', in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

Op Sindoor is ongoing; 100 terrorists killed, all parties told, say sourcesOperation Sindoor: At the all-party meeting, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said 100 terrorists were killed in 'precise' attacks on nine terrorist hideouts in Pakistan.

Jaish chief's brother critically injured in strikes under Op Sindoor: SourcesAbdul Rauf Asghar, Masood Azhar's brother and Jaish's second-in-command, is reportedly undergoing treatment at a Pakistani military hospital after sustaining serious injuries in the Indian strikes.

Trading halted on Pakistan stock exchange after 7% crash post Operation SindoorAccording to the official notification from the exchange, trading was paused after the benchmark index plunged 6.3% in a short period. The sharp fall triggered automatic circuit breakers to stop further decline.

What might have gone into making Operation Sindoor a successOperation Sindoor's success can be attributed to the culmination of the seamless integration of satellite, drone, and human intelligence with precise strikes by the IAF's fighter jets, executed under tight inter-service coordination. This is what might have happened in the days leading up to Operation Sindoor, and how it was executed.

15 civilians, jawan killed in Pak firing along LoC; UN team, villagers evacuatedThe latest round of shelling came hours after India launched Operation Sindoor, a high-precision military offensive that struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

Missile debris found in Amritsar village after explosions heard, Army on spotMissile debris has been found in the border area in Amritsar after locals said they heard multiple explosions past midnight. Army personnel are on the spot to assess the situation.

Were Chinese jets used by Pak to respond to Op Sindoor? What Beijing saidOperation Sindoor, launched at 1.05 am on Wednesday, involved a 25-minute series of precision strikes by Indian air, naval, and ground forces on nine terror camps in Pakistan POK.

Kashmir after Baisaran: 10 takeawaysPost the horrendous terror attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran meadows and the Indian armed forces retaliation, it is apparent that Kashmir is churning yet again, the churn reflecting many dimensions, old and new.

Op Sindoor Live: PM reviews national preparedness with top ministry secretariesOperation Sindoor Live Updates: India carried out precision strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in response to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack which killed 26 people. The government said its actions have been "focused, measured and non-escalatory in nature" and that "no Pakistani military facilities have been targeted". Prime Minister Narendra Modi told his colleagues in the Cabinet meeting that it was a proud moment for everyone following the operation. The government held an all-party meeting today and briefed the Opposition following Operation Sindoor.  Follow Indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

Who is Sajid Mir, terrorist killed and brought back to life by PakistanDuring a press briefing on Operation Sindoor, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri spoke about Sajid Mir, a terrorist declared dead by Pakistan in its attempt to shield him. Under international pressure, Pakistan was forced to admit that Mir was alive. He was one of the key plotters of the 26/11 terror attacks and the chief handler of the terrorists involved in the attack.

Pak national shot dead at Punjab border, attempted to cross despite warningThe Pakistani national was challenged by the BSF, but continued moving forward, prompting troops to open fire. He was shot dead on the spot.

Anushka-Virat step out for a dinner date, fans notice something unusualIn their first public appearance since the Avneet Kaur controversy, Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli were seen on a dinner date in Bengaluru. However, fans noticed something unusual, sparking a wave of online discussion.

Desi 'suicide drones', expert in shoot-to-kill ops, make debut with SindoorOperation Sindoor: The SkyStriker 'suicide drones', developed in Bengaluru, made their operational debut during Operation Sindoor, where nine terror camps in Pakistan were destroyed.

US, UK, others urge citizens to avoid J&K travel amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsTension escalated after the Indian armed forces launched Operation Sindoor aimed at dismantling terror networks in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (POK).

PM Modi's first message after Operation Sindoor as Centre briefs partiesThe opposition parties were told about the valour of the armed forces as India struck terror camps deep inside Pakistan in an operation codenamed 'Sindoor'.

Diljit Dosanjh gives desi-style review to fancy breakfast served after Met GalaDiljit Dosanjh's funny review of a fancy Louis Vuitton breakfast after the Met Gala 2025 has gone viral, winning over fans with his desi humour.

Passenger beaten up in 3AC coach over pricing complaint. Railways reacts to videoIn the now-viral video, several men - allegedly pantry staff - are seen walking into the train compartment and confronting the passenger as he rests on his third-tier berth.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

Op Sindoor's 100% precision: Satellite pics show direct hit on Jaish terror campCaptured by Maxar Technologies, the satellite visuals show before-and-after comparisons of sites in Bahawalpur and Muridke, both known strongholds of banned terror outfits.

Kia Carens Clavis unveiled, new tech-loaded avatar to enhance premium characterKia has launched the Carens Clavis, an upgraded version of the Carens with new design and more features. The Clavis will be offered alongside the existing Carens lineup.

21 airports shut till May 10, high alert: Border states on vigil after Op SindoorNationwide alerts, school and airport closures, government leave cancellations and emergency drills marked India's heightened security posture after Operation Sindoor — a precision military strike on terror hubs in Pakistan and POK.

Rohit Sharma slams Indian commentary standards, says criticism is agenda-drivenRohit Sharma accused Indian commentators of focusing on a single star player and repeatedly discussing his personal life, rather than appreciating and analysing the game itself.

IAF calls back Gaganyaan astronaut to his unit after Operation SindoorGroup Captain Ajit Krishnan, who was attending the Global Space Exploration Conference in Delhi, confirmed to media that he was leaving the capital early to rejoin his team.

sports.headline: BCCI to honour Indian armed forces with B Praak performance in DharamshalaThe BCCI will honour the Indian armed forces with a special tribute ahead of the IPL 2025 clash between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamshala on Thursday.

PBKS vs DC Dharamshala weather forecast today: Will rain affect crunch IPL 2025 game?IPL 2025: Delhi Capitals take on Punjab Kings in a crucial clash at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamshala. Both teams would not want rain interruption as the result of the big-ticket game could be decisive to their playoffs hopes.

Jasprit Bumrah should lead India's Test side on England tour: Anil KumbleFormer India skipper Anil Kumble said he would like to see pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah lead India in their five-match Test tour of England in June-July.

BCCI punishes Varun Chakravarthy for IPL code of conduct breach vs CSKKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) spinner Varun Chakravarthy was fined 25 percent of his match fee and handed one demerit point for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) at Eden Gardens.

Rohit Sharma did not announce Test retirement in a hurry: Childhood coachRohit Sharma's childhood coach Dinesh Lad said his ward did not take the decision to retire from Test cricket in haste. Rohit announced retirement weeks ahead of the selection for the Test team for the tour of England, starting June 20.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
